column2: ITP Description: Camms Road Horizontal Directional Drilling-SEW
ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
• All pipes must meet project specification
• All pipes must meet project specification
• Review and approval of grout specification
• PE welders are to be pre-Qualified
3.2 Check that current revision drawings are being used
• Drawing revison must be confirmed with the design manager
• DBYD Asset owners responses and requirements.
• Set out line and level of drilling works.
• Survey to mark out existing services.
• Must maintain a min. of 600mm clearance to any existing service and a min. 3m clearance to any Railway Structure UON.
• Joints are to be butt welded.
• Butt Welding records to be supplied.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Location as per current Drill shot plans
• Drill to be installed as per the survey setout.
REFERENCE: Grout Manufacturer Technical Data Sheet
• Mixing and proportioning of grouting to take place as per Technical Data Sheet provided with product.
• Only whole bags of product shall be used.
• Grouting shall not commence when temperature is below 5 degrees Celsius or above 35 degrees Celsius
• Grout mixture should be mixed adequately and free from lumps
5.4 Clean surrounding faces and remove excess grout
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Area free of excess grout and spillage
REFERENCE: Grout Manufacturer Technical Data Sheet
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Curing in accordance with TDS
• Auditing to be completed on conduit ends prior to backfilling of entry and exit shafts.
FREQUENCY: Prior to backfill of exit/entry shafts
• REINSTATEMENT OF BORE SHAFTS SHALL FOLLOW MRWA BACKFILL SPECIFICATION MRWA-W-201 Table 201-A & 201-B;
• Entry pits, exit pits and trenches to be backfilled with Type A or crushed rock. Backfill material shall be compacted to the same density as adjacent material or as specified.
• Acceptance and closeout of subcontractor ITP
• ATTACHED: Completed and Signed Subcontractor ITP
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed.
FREQUENCY: Once, prior to closure of this lot / element / Work area
• Survey as built report to be compiled.
• Autocad and PDF reports are to be supplied.
• All RFIs, NCRs and changes to the IFC drawings are captured on a controlled drawing set marked "Red-line", "As-built" or similar.
FREQUENCY: Once, after construction of the design package
Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance Final Inspection

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
